Extra Features

  • Show Recaps
Dumpedit
  • Docs »
  • Channel
  • View page source

Channel¶

Channels are the hub for your shows. Here you can create or edit Shows, Suggestion Pools, Vote Types, Players, and even export user e-mails that have signed in at your shows. Channels are where you access the Show Controller to direct the show’s voting and the Show Display which is used to display the voting and voting results to the audience. Channels are also what your audience interacts with on their mobile browsers to login, enter suggestions, and vote.

Create/Edit Players¶

Channels allow you to create or edit Players that peform in your Shows. When you create a Show, you can add Players that users can vote for (or vote for suggestions assigned to the player) during your improv show.

Note

Only active Players will appear on the Show creation page.

Create/Edit Suggestion Pools¶

Your Channel allows you to create or edit Suggestion Pools, which are types of suggestions that your audience can enter before the show. Once users have entered suggestions, they are used in conjunction with Vote Types to allow the audience to vote on the suggestions they’ve entered.

Note

Only active Suggestion Pools will appear on the Vote Type creation page.

Create/Edit Vote Types¶

Channels allow you to create or edit Vote Types, which are used to determine how the audience votes during the show. Vote Types allow you to vote on suggestions, Players combined with suggestions, or audience members can vote for Players within the show.

Note

Suggestion Pools aren’t required for Vote Types where you only vote for Players. Only active Vote Types will appear on the Show creation page.

Create/Edit/Delete Shows¶

Channels allow you to create, edit, or delete Shows, which allow audience members to interact live with your improv show through your Channel. Shows allow you to define what votes will take place during your improv show and what Players are participating in your improv show. You can also add a youtube video and photo from your show for the Show Recaps.

Note

Players are not required to create a show if the selected Vote Types don’t require players.

Channel Pre-show Instructions¶

Channel Pre-show Instructions is a page on your channel used to instruct your audience how to interact with the show. It informs them how to log into the show, what suggestion types to enter, and encourages them to upvote.

Note

We leave the Pre-show Instructions up on the projector before the show so that audience members learn how to use the app as they are waiting for the show to begin.

Export Show E-mails (Premium Only Feature)¶

You can Export E-mails of the users that sign in at your show. The exports are CSV (comma separated) format and contain the user’s e-mail address, user id, first name, last name, and submitted suggestions (for show exports only).

Note

If a user unsubscribes to your mailings, you must remove them from you mailing list according to the Anti-Spam Act. Failure to do so could result in a heafty fine or lawsuit. We typically use Mailchimp as our e-mail service to manage our mailing lists and create e-mail blasts to announce our shows.

Editable Channel Fields¶

Url Name¶

Url Name appears as www.dumpedit.com/your_channel/ in the site’s url. This is where users can access your Channel.

Note

Url Names may only contain letters, numbers, hyphens or underscores.

Display Name¶

Display Name is how the name of your Channel appears on the site. It should typically be the name of your theater or show.

Short Description¶

Short Description is a short blurb used to describe your show.

Description¶

Description is used to describe your show and appears on your Channel‘s about page.

Logo Image¶

Logo Image appears on your Channel‘s Show Display page when users aren’t actively voting.

Note

Logo Images must be smaller than 2 MBs.

Team Photo¶

Team Photo is the photo of your show or cast and appears on your Channel‘s about page.

Note

Team Photos must be smaller than 2 MBs.

Website¶

Website is the web address of your show or theater and appears on your Channel‘s about page.

Facebook Page (Premium Only Feature)¶

Facebook Page is the Facebook page for your show or theater and allows users to “Like” your page from your Channel‘s home page, Live Voting page, and about page.

Buy Tickets Link (Premium Only Feature)¶

Buy Tickets Link is a button on your Channel‘s home page that links users to your ticket purchasing url.

Next Show¶

Next Show appears on your Channel‘s home page and about page and let’s users know when your next show is.

Navbar Color (Premium Only Feature)¶

Navbar Color allows you to change the color of your navigation bar at the top of your Channel‘s pages.

Background Color (Premium Only Feature)¶

Background Color allows you to change the background color of your Channel‘s pages.

Address¶

Address helps make your shows easier to access/locate and also appears on your Channel‘s about page.
